description: From Ancient Greek χᾰ́ρῐσμᾰ (khárisma, “grace, favour, gift”), from χᾰρῐ́ζομαι (kharízomai, “I show favor”), from χᾰ́ρῐς (kháris, “grace”), from χαίρω (khaírō, “I am happy”).

nouns.description: charisma (usually uncountable, plural charismas or charismata)

entries.meaning: (Christianity) An extraordinary power granted by the Holy Spirit.
The ability to influence without the use of logic.
